security: The memorandum discusses the dissemination of an Identi-Kit composite of James Earl Ray, which could reveal law enforcement or intelligence methods used to identify suspects. The inclusion of coded information and distribution lists could expose sensitive communication channels. Quoting directly from the memo: "the coded information was communicated to you for dissemination." and "We are forwarding, for your information, a copy of the composite, along with the photographs and list of stations received from your office."
summary: A memo from TSD/AB/PDS to DDP/CI, specifically Richard Ober, providing an Identi-Kit composite of James Earl Ray in response to a request, including coded information and photographs for dissemination.
summary_one_paragraph: On April 24, 1968, a memorandum from TSD/AB/PDS, authored by Edward M. Sudol, was sent to DDP/CI, addressed to Richard Ober, regarding the Identi-Kit composite of James Earl Ray. In response to a request made on April 20, 1968, an Identi-Kit composite of James Earl Ray was completed. The memorandum communicates the coded information for dissemination, forwards a copy of the composite, along with photographs and a station distribution list, for informational purposes, and was assembled with the cooperation of Mr. Joseph Baglio.
title: Identi-Kit Composite of James Earl Ray
origin_agency: TSD/AB/PDS (Technical Services Division/Audio Branch/Photographic Development Staff)
